pr_title: Show network name in exception message

timeline.bodyText: this might yield an NPE hiding the original problem, no?
timeline.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText:
I see no problem in adding an if checking for a non-null name. However, a network can only be created with a name.
If the network is a non-null Object then I don't see how the name would be null. Unless manual queries have been executed on DB (messing with networks) or there are some bugs on the network removal/update process.
replies.author: GabrielBrascher

replies.bodyText: @DaanHoogland @GabrielBrascher most of the time the network name will be nonnull but there is no harm adding an extra if check. I will modify the code
replies.author: ravening

replies.bodyText: I am talking about the model returning a network in the first place. the namer being null will probably just print "<null>", @ravening @GabrielBrascher
replies.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText: @DaanHoogland we are iterating over the list of networks which got populated earlier and it contains only valid existing networks. so networkmodel shouldnt return null
replies.author: ravening

replies.bodyText: @ravening How about just adding the network name to the NetworkVO toString(), so this remains the same, and we get to see the network's name along with other details like networkId, traffic type, etc?
